definition: to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)

sentences.english: The two armies converge on the enemy capital for the last battle of the war.
sentences.chinese: 兩軍聚集在敵方首都，準備一決勝負。

sentences.english: Then the final showdown with the bad kung fu kids.
sentences.chinese: 然後結局定會和反派功夫小子一決勝負。

sentences.english: Russia is mobilizing its troops for another showdown with Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯正在調兵遣將，要與格魯吉亞再決勝負。

sentences.english: I'll break a lance with you in argument.
sentences.chinese: 我要和你辯論，一決勝負。

sentences.english: Want to play me in basketball?
sentences.chinese: 要跟我打籃球一決勝負嗎？

sentences.english: The top teams will play off seven games against each other.
sentences.chinese: 優勝隊之間相互要打七場比賽以決勝負。

sentences.english: We never planned to have a showdown with anybody.
sentences.chinese: 我們從沒想到過要和任何人一決勝負。

sentences.english: After years of waiting, these two bitter rivals are finally poised for the ultimate showdown.
sentences.chinese: 等待數年之後，兩軍終於準備好一決勝負。
